Korea's reunification supported
articles.content:
Korea's reunification supported
   Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Josho, Japan, District Society for Supporting Korea's Reunification which visited the DPRK published a statement in Pyongyang on May 26 and expressed the firm belief that the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea will surely be achieved on the basis of the five-point policy of great national unity advanced by General Secretary  Kim Jong Il.   
   The statement expressed full support for the Korean people in their powerful struggle to glorify Korean-style socialism and reunify the country, rallied close around Kim Jong Il, true to the behest of the President Kim Il Sung.
   In order to improve the Japan-DPRK relations, it said, Japan should apologize for its past crimes and, fulfil, before anything else, the legal and moral obligation for the development of friendship between the two peoples on the basis of the joint declaration of three parties and the 1995 agreement of four parties on the Japan-DPRK relations.

articles.title: Reception by Ethiopian charge d'affaires ad interim
articles.content:
Reception by Ethiopian charge d'affaires ad interim
   Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Dubale Belihu, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Ethiopian embassy in the DPRK, gave a reception in Pyongyang on May 28, the national holiday of the Ethiopian people.
    Invited there were Pak Song Chol, Honorary Vice-President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Ri Won Il, Minister of Labour and chairman of the Korea-Ethiopia Friendship and Solidarity Committee, and officials concerned.
    Foreign diplomatic envoys to the DPRK were also invited there.
    Speeches were made there.

Repatriation of unconverted long-term prisoners called for
articles.content:
Repatriation of unconverted long-term prisoners called for
   Pyongyang,Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- a signature campaign demanding the repatriation of unconverted long-term prisoners in South Korea kim in so and Ham Se Hwan has been conducted from May 24 under the sponsorship of the Asian regional committee for Korea's reunification and the Indian committee for their repatriation.
   The signature paper said that though more than 40 years have passed since the cease-fire in Korea, the South Korean authorities have not yet sent the unconverted long-term prisoners back to the north. This is a wanton violation of the international law including the Geneva convention, it noted.
It strongly demanded kim in so, Ham Se Hwan and other unconverted long-term prisoners in South Korea be immediately sent back to the democratic people's republic of Korea where their families are awaiting them.

articles.title: Heaviest financial deficit of S. Korea
articles.content:
Heaviest financial deficit of S. Korea
   Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- South Korea posted the heaviest financial deficit in history last year, or 18,700 billion won,  according to a report.
   This was caused by the authorities' excessive issue of bonds and massive introduction of loans from foreign countries to cope with foreign exchange crisis.

articles.title: 7th-term Hanchongryon inaugural meeting praised
articles.content:
7th-term Hanchongryon inaugural meeting praised
   Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- the South Korean federation of university student councils (Hanchongryon) declared its 7th-term inauguration in the teeth of  suppression by the authorities, thus demonstrating its dignity and might as the vanguard of independence, democracy and reunification to the world,  says the press here today.
   Rodong Sinmun in a commentary says:   the inauguration means a disgraceful defeat to the South Korean authorities but a great victory to the patriotic-minded students who are fighting for the cause of justice.
   Indeed, Hanchongryon has made a praiseworthy start this time for the nation and the country despite manifold difficulties.
   To defend and support it is precisely the road for the nation and patriotism.
   South Koreans who aspire after independence, democracy and reunification should defend Hanchongryon, braving the suppression by the authorities,  and take the  same step with patriotic-minded students.
   Minju Joson in a commentary says that the South Korean authorities' mobilization of above 1,000 riot police of 18 companies to suppress the 7th-term inaugural meeting is a heinous fascist repression.
   The commentary calls for an immediate halt to suppression of Hanchongryon and the abolition of the notorious "national security law."

articles.title: Greetings to President of Croatia
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Croatia
   Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- kim yong nam, president of the presidium of the supreme people's assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Croatian president Franjo Tudjman on the occasion of the independence day of Croatia.
   The message wished the president and people of Croatia success in the work for the stability and prosperity of the country.
Meanwhile, premier of the cabinet hong song nam and foreign minister paek nam sun respectively sent messages of greetings to Croatian prime minister Zlatko Matesa and Mate Granic.

articles.title: Rumour of "drug trafficking"
articles.content:
Rumour of "drug trafficking"
    Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- a few days ago, the Thai newspaper Bangkok Post  in an article  said the DPRK is engaged in "drug trafficking."
   This is an utterly groundless false propaganda and a despicable and dastardly literary hackwork that deserves to be denounced and scorned by the people.
   As is known,  in the DPRK the people have very sound ideological consciousness and a cultured way of life, help and lead each other forward and form a big harmonious family. So, narcotics can be found nowhere and smuggling it into other countries is not imaginable at all.
   The DPRK is shocked by the Thai newspaper's faked-up propaganda that the DPRK processes and smuggles drug into Asia. What astonishes us all the more is the fact that the newspaper described the DPRK as a "drug nightmare".
   In the article the newspaper again touched on the ephedrine issue that had  occurred in Thailand  in January last year.  At that time, our competent organ legally imported ephedrine through official proceedings under the approval of the UN international drug control council from the outset. But it suffered a big loss for some unknown reason. Therefore, the DPRK has more to say about it.
   Such being the case,  the Bangkok Post slandered the DPRK in the article written with false materials.
   Much effort is not needed to guess what it pursued in the false propaganda.
   In a nutshell, it is nothing but a despicable attempt to impair the international prestige of the DPRK and isolate it on the world arena and, in particular, to drive a wedge into the friendly relations between the DPRK and Thailand.
   It is as clear as noonday that underlying it is a political scheme of the United States, Japan and the South Korean ruling quarters to tarnish the prestige of the dignified DPRK.
   Not content with heaping abuses on the DPRK over the non-existent "nuclear and missile issue", the United States, Japan and the South Korean ruling quarters are now spreading the false rumour of "drug trafficking" through the Bangkok Post devoid of faith and principle.
   They are trying to stifle the DPRK  through the loud-mouthed international cooperation.
  Anyone who intends to  violate the dignity of the DPRK will be held wholly responsible for all consequences to be entailed therefrom.
   The Thai newspaper Bangkok Post can not be an exception. 
Its groundless slander of the DPRK for a few dollars will face denunciation by public opinion.
